Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
About LIL:
==========
We are a software and design lab tucked inside the world's largest academic law library, building tools and communities for open knowledge. We build open-source software and web services, available to everyone and in the public interest, to explore and to solve emerging information problems from our shared perspective as librarians, programmers, artists, and lawyers. We currently support three long-running services ( Perma, H2O Open Casebook, and the Caselaw Access Project ) as well as a range of shorter term experiments.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
About the datasets:
===================

We are looking to onboard 4 datasets:

* Google Books Archive: ~75TB
* Caselaw Access Project: ~12TB (https://lil.law.harvard.edu/projects/caselaw-access-project/)
* H20: <1TB (https://lil.law.harvard.edu/projects/h2o/)
* Perma.cc: ~24TB (https://lil.law.harvard.edu/projects/perma-cc/)

At this time, we are looking for 1TB of DataCap for testing.
Project.Please share a sample of the data (a lin: I do not have samples with me at this time.  Links to 3 of the 4 datasources above point the way to public access data repositories though.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, North America, Europe
